epp:phrases.epp:phrase: Indicate if a pre-payment arrangement was used for the open access cost. Field could be used to avoid double counting pre-payment costs in budgetary analysis. This will default to 'unspecified' until yes or no are selected.

epp:phrase.p: The official date the the actual cost was paid to the supplier as per the official finance system.
Not the date the cost was committed or paid on any library serials system.

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: Indicate which budget the cost has been assigned to. This can help with budgetary management. Select 'Third party' if another organisation is paying the open access costs. 'Gold other' can be used for any paid for open access that does not fall into any of the other categories. This can be explained in the notes field below.

epp:phrase.p: A unique identifier supplied by the publisher. Often found on emails of acceptance.
This reference number is a useful identifier in the payment process as the official DOI often does not exist at the early stage.
The estimated cost of the open access including VAT at the point where it is agreed to pay for an item but before the invoice has paid out from the official finance system.
It is not necessary to complete this field if a pre-payment has been set to 'Yes'.

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: Use this field to enter notes about open access decisions, e.g. it looks like the publisher allows immediate open access, but it is not clear so I have asked for confirmation.

epp:phrase.table:
The main purpose of these types is for triage of newly accepted publications, so that staff know what decision has been taken or that a decision is pending.
Type Explanation
Green Article will be made freely available without any additional cost.
Gold APC to be paid from RCUK block grant.
No OA Option No open access options available from publisher at time of checking.
Outwith Scope E.g. Article was published before 1st April 2013 and therefore does not fit criteria for this funding.
Pending Decision to be made e.g. await decision from publisher or information from author.
No Green OA Option There is no free open access route available (if not RCUK funded we cannot facilitate open access by a free route).
Other Only use this option where none of the other choices are suitable.

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: Indicate if funders and their award numbers are included in the paper.

Indicate if the paper includes a statement on how the underlying research materials - such as data, samples or models â€“ can be accessed. It is not necessary that the data itself be openly accessible if there are compelling reasons against this.
The actual cost (excluding VAT) at the point that this shows as paid on the official finance system. This could be the sum of several transactions.
The actual VAT value at the point this shows as paid on the official finance system. This could be the sum of several transactions.
Use this field to enter the period in which the costs were actually paid e.g. 201505. Some financial reporting is based around period rather than actual pay date.
Enter the finance system transaction number. There can be more than one transaction per publication.
Enter the five digit Finance Project code.
